pullRequest.title: DHFPROD-5984: Adding indexes to filter on sourceName and sourceType as hub facets
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Checklist:
- Note: do not change the below


Owner:


 JIRA_ID included in all the commit messages


 PR title is in the format JIRA_ID:Title


 Rebase the branch with upstream


 Squashed all commits into a single commit


 Added Tests


Reviewer:


 Reviewed Tests

nodes.bodyText:
I'm now remembering that if we modify this file in particular, we have to update HubProjectImpl:upgradeProject so that this addition is made programmatically. That's because we can't just overwrite this file, as the user may have made changes in it.
For that reason, I'm thinking it's better to add the es path-namespace to the XML fields files and then enhance DeployDatabaseFieldsCommand to ensure that the es path-namespace is added if it doesn't exist yet. And we'll need to add tests to verify that it properly adds it or doesn't add it.

I don't think this is the right way to test this, because we're not programmatically generating any options - we're just hardcoding two new options in.
Instead, I think we need an ml-test that loads a couple documents - one with sourceName/sourceType, the other without - and then use search:search with the installed options. Then verify that the search:response has the facets for sourceName/sourceType. That verifies both that the options were generated correctly and that they work.

afterCommit.message: DHFPROD-5984: Adding indexes to filter on sourceName and sourceType as hub facets

nodes.bodyText: We know path-namespaces exists in newProps - I don't see the point of this null check here?
You don't need this check here - prefix is a required field, it's guaranteed to exist.
Same thing, don't need the isNotBlank check - if a path-namespace exists, it's guaranteed to have a prefix.
No need for a separate test here - just add the path-namespace stuff to the existing DeployDatabaseFieldCommandTest .

nodes.bodyText: The comment above this should be removed now - and really, we ought to explain why the project is being created here. So I think a comment of "Need to create the project directory before applying properties" (assuming that is the correct reason).
